title: How to Draw a Boar

steps.headline: Draw the head.
steps.description: Sketch a circle and a trapezoid with curved-in sides as shown. Add faint guidelines for features, where the ears and snout will be.

steps.headline: Draw a small circle for the eyes.
steps.description: Add spades for the ears and small, upward-curving triangles for the tusks.

steps.headline: Draw a large oval for the upper body and a smaller one for the backside.
steps.description: Add in a set of two ovals for each leg; don't forget to draw hooves. Add in a thin, tufted tail.

steps.headline: Sketch in the fur and figure of the boar.
steps.description: Erase guidelines so that the primary focus becomes the detailing of the body. Also emphasize the shape hooves more, although you should keep them very small to the rest of the boar.

steps.headline: Outline and color in your boar.
steps.description: Use dark colors, and use shadowing/highlighting to make it look more realistic.

text: Draw the head. Sketch a circle and a trapezoid with curved-in sides as shown. Add faint guidelines for features, where the ears and snout will be. Draw a small circle for the eyes. Add spades for the ears and small, upward-curving triangles for the tusks. Draw a large oval for the upper body and a smaller one for the backside. Add in a set of two ovals for each leg; don't forget to draw hooves. Add in a thin, tufted tail. Sketch in the fur and figure of the boar. Erase guidelines so that the primary focus becomes the detailing of the body. Also emphasize the shape hooves more, although you should keep them very small to the rest of the boar. Outline and color in your boar. Use dark colors, and use shadowing/highlighting to make it look more realistic. Finished.
